website_summaries.verdict: The Shure SE425 sound-isolating earphones are an excellent choice for eclectic listeners who demand stellar audio and a high-quality design.
pros: The Shure SE425 earphones provide fantastic audio quality and a durable design
The package includes useful extras such as a case, a quarter-inch adapter, and the Shure Fit Kit
cons: The Shure SE425 earphones will not fit all users comfortably, and they take some effort to put on
Shure has eliminated its modular cable design

customer_reviews.title: Excellent IEM, great sound isolation, not the best for music listening.`
customer_reviews.text: So I kind of grabbed these on a whim. I own a few monitor-style heatphones/earphones so I knew what to expect. These aren't your every-day commuter earphones. They're definitely designed with live sound in mind - that being said, once you find the right tips for your ear, these sound fantastic. At first I was disappointed with glaring mids and nonexistent lows, but as I tried different tips I found that they were fairly adequate for a headset of this price. I was intending to return them at first, but I am getting used to their sound and will likely keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Kryzm

customer_reviews.title: Serious Upgrade from Single-Driver Version
customer_reviews.text: I'm a drummer and use these on stage for in-ears but also in the practice room. With the single-driver version I'd have to keep my Roland SPD-SX sampler volume jacked all the way up, but with these dual-driver jawns I can keep the volume just over halfway. Comes with a variety of ear pieces to customize your fit. Using a smaller ear piece would allow more of the room sound to come in.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan McCourt

customer_reviews.title: Worse sound quality than my Shure 215SE
customer_reviews.text: This is suppose to be 2 levels ahead of the 215 series. It isn't even close. Horrible sound quality. Some songs it is about 10% better mid tones. Some songs it is equal but different than 215SE. But other songs? It is actually WAYYY WORSE than my 215SE. GreenDay American Idiot & Kimbra Cameo Lover both sounded horrible on this but great on my 215SE. Just awful.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: average sounding
customer_reviews.text: Decided to splurge on this pair of earbuds.Not to crazy about their sound.Guess I'm too use to over the ear headphones.Too late for me to return them.I admit this is my first pair of in ear types in many years.I make sure I have a good seal.Thought I would get better resolution or clarity with a more expensive pair.I use them indoors with headphone amps and dacs.Maybe I should have tried a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. Great sound. Fits great in ear. Comfortable. Fits flat so can lie on side. I don’t really know the difference between the various versions so could only take a guess. Happy with my choice. I can definitely tell the difference compared to less expensive earphones. Had Bose previously and these are much better. The wire is very long so it stays out of the way. Like how the wire wraps over the ear and secures behind the head.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: They do sound good in the mid to upper range but I could use a little more bass. I prefer headphones that are not base heavy, Sennheiser HD600’s for example. These didn’t suit my needs. I understand these are monitors and are supposed to be flat but it just seemed the bass was light. Tried all the included tips. Foam tips work the best for isolating sound in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: dersom

customer_reviews.title: Got defective unit. VERY DISPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: First time buying shure product. VERY disappointed. Got defective unit. It came with defect aux cable where I have to rotate aux to curtain angle to listen to sound. Seems like it has great noise cancellation but that's about it. The sound is pretty similar to my 1mopre triple driver earphone. Waiting for new unit to arrive to test and compare with 1more triple driver earphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Beats My 215s
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Shure 215s for awhile and these beat them by a mile with clean and clear mids and highs and more bass response. Both models are great on airplanes as well. I can hear the movie soundtracks really well over the plane noise. However, I still wouldn't use them for serious mixing due to the lesser bass response with any of these types of earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: The real deal, these are great but you have to take some time with them.
customer_reviews.text: If you think using these will be exactly the same as using monitors ( but better ) be aware, they can be, but you have to really invest some time in both selecting the ear buds and the getting microphones to record everything so you can control what you hear. I use them but it takes time and a knowledgeable sound guy.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sound good, but they don't last more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the shell of the right iem separates every 6 months or so. I purchased this product in April of 2017 and I've had to warranty them three times so far. I'm not sure what's causing it to happen, as I'm careful not to handle them roughly and careful of what I use to clean them. I'm pretty frustrated and disappointed to have spent so much on them, and to only get 6 months of casual use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: J Storer

customer_reviews.title: Shurely great
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Shure headphones. The previous pair was the SE215, which were also great. Part of my job involves a lot of thinking and planning, often alone, so I plug these babies into my ears for hours at a time. I've never had issues with comfort, and the sound quality is the best I've experienced thus far -- not surprising since these are the best quality headphones I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade from SE215?... depends...
customer_reviews.text: For those looking for an upgrade from the Shure SE215s, these WILL have a lot more detail and sound nicer, but personally, I was disappointed with the amount of bass (especially how much punch it didn't have) and the SE215s for sure had more bass. I ended up picking up some SE535s used on eBay for slightly cheaper and they are very satisfying. I'm sure they have their place, but there was a big lac of bass in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Super accurate, Super isolating
customer_reviews.text: They are just what everyone else says about them, Super accurate, Super isolating, and very comfortable. Unfortunately they lacked bass for my taste. I used to have some 200 series, and they had more thump. You can coax bass out of these 425s, but you have to play with the eq. In the end I returned them and bought some 535s for about $70 more (look around). I just received the 535s about an hour ago, and they are every bit as clear (read amazing) as the 425, but they can get slightly louder, and they aren't missing any bass. I am now super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Shure SE425's good???  They're GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tony Tiger would find these in-ear monitors to be wonderful. They do a pretty darn good job of noise cancelleing, and you can feel the bass frequencies in your chest somehow! I love them. If you sing and/or smile while you play, you may experience a little moment of silence in your head, but of course you must try all the ear tips (included) so that you might find the ones that suit you best. You won't want to use any standard headphones in your iPod or record player or CD player... Or whatever!!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for drummers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a drummer and wanted something that can act as hearing protection as well and man do these do the trick! I actually had to send the drums through the monitors so I know what I'm doing as they worked so well I couldn't really hear my own drumming! Overall sound quality was good as well but the low end was not as present as I would have liked. Nonetheless these do a great job and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Clarity and Seperation.
customer_reviews.text: Love the clarity of sound! I had been using s set of Sennheiser earphones for in-ear monitors, and decided it was time to upgrade. Wow! What a difference. I had much better separation of instruments, which led to an amazing clarity of sound, and I was able to turn down my overall master level because of the more isolation from the Shures. My only regret is not making this purchase earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R Bennett

customer_reviews.title: What you pay is what you get!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset....with myself for not getting them any time sooner. A friend let me listen to his 425 and I was sold. Same night ordered. I happen to fly a lot and never could hear well due to airplane noise what I was listening to even at maximum volume which became painful to ears. So flew 4 times with the 425 ....what can i say once they are on you forget where you are. I like loud music and now I dont even go past 75% volume.Clean sound of music, very clear and have plenty of bass for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones. You need to take them apart after vigorous exercise, otherwise parts will corode.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Labno, PT, DPT

customer_reviews.title: Great IEM's
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. Totally helped with sound fatigue. One of the best purchases I've made. They have a mid-rangy tone which is great for guitarist. The only way I would improve these is to upgrade to the 3 drive model but that's a lot more $$$$$
customer_reviews.author: Apo

customer_reviews.title: great quality and perfect sound
customer_reviews.text: I use it to play piano and listen music, great quality as any Shure product
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the westones and price not bad for drums and bass. Not keys or vocals. They are warm.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cummins

customer_reviews.title: for a pro musician
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé asked me to purchase these for his job. He's a band leader who has taken his group to total wireless. All members of the group have wireless earphones. Price is high, but that's the manufacturer, not Amazon. Arrived on time. Good packaging. Decent earphones. Shure makes a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Moondance

customer_reviews.title: Great IEMs
customer_reviews.text: As a bass player I was wondering if these would provide the low end response that I like to hear.. They do... Very clear through the entire frequency range. I also have the SE215 which are good but these are a nice step above those.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 4th set of the SHURE SE425 headphones over the last 7 years and the only reason is because I lost them or the dog ate one set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality performance is entirely dependent on the earpieces you choose. Choose wisely! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well balanced sound!
customer_reviews.text: Crystal clear and clean sound. With the right ear tips these IEMs will be your favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Using various earphones for 22 years on stage. These are the best I have come across.
customer_reviews.author: RedBird

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but the design and fit need work
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming from these small earphones is spectacular. However the wire that goes over the ear is too stiff to mold over the ear. I am hoping that with more use the wire becomes more pliable. There is no clip to attach the long and heavy cord to your shirt or clothes. I used the earphones on a long flight and the noise cancellation feature worked extremely well. Once the earphones are correctly fit into the ear they work quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Thad King

customer_reviews.title: Great, as expected
customer_reviews.text: They sound great and fit great. I expect quality products from Shure, and this did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pope

customer_reviews.title: These sound fantastic! I had a issue with one earbud breaking ...
customer_reviews.text: These sound fantastic! I had a issue with one earbud breaking and the customer service was fantastic... I strongly recommend anything from Shure!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliantly clean and great fidelity. The fit is awesome. Well worth the money. Not cheap, but sweet.
customer_reviews.author: RG Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding in-ear headphones with serious flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding in-ear headphones, but 1. You expect them to last more than a year => *WRONG. A cable at a swivel connection gives up after a typical 1-year use. A well-known problem it seems, after I ran into it and did some googling. 2. For 300$ you would expect no problems with a careful use => *WRONG*, see 1. 3. A design f***-up: series should be recalled. So just skip this one and wait until the problem is fixed in the next gen. -3 stars as I found out about these "wear&tear" problems a year into while being a very careful user => no twists, no stretches, no humidity, etc. etc.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelijus

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! They are comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! They are comfortable for me. I tried 5 different Earphones before I spent the money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Duit

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are good, well packaged but take a while to get used to fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Amazing  sound, a little expensive.
customer_reviews.text: This are my first Shure headphones, i've had Klipsch S4, Bose In-ear and Klipsch X10, they sound really really good, once you find the right way to wear them, but are a little pricey, if you dont want to pay $300 for this ones, I recommend the Klipsch X10 which are about $100 to $150 and sound similar to the shure se425.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great but the cable came with problem as left side ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great but the cable came with problem as left side earbud volume is much smaller than right side and twisting the cable sometimes makes the left side volume normal. Quite upset with the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Bamboo

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of the sound. The ear pieces take a while to feel comfy. For what I am using them for they are working great!
customer_reviews.author: Averee

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: On my last trip to Italy I took off my Bose because I was sweating around the ear, put in my Shure's for the rest of the trip! Just the best in biz, hands down..
customer_reviews.author: GrndLkNatv

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Quick Delivery. Made a Nice Christmas present. Would buy from again! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Ann

customer_reviews.title: Sound Amazing... Miss Old Style
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my broken SE420's which sounded amazing. These also sound great but aren't as comfortable on the ear. I can wear them for about 2 hours until the redesigned body start to really press against my lower ear causing discomfort. I also really miss the detachable cable wear the two wires split. Ideal if you are using the "Push to Hear" device.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Drummer approved
customer_reviews.text: I need a headset that provided the studio quality sound for me to play the drums along with. The sound quality is breathtaking and it provides enoughisolation so I can hear the music
customer_reviews.author: sdfasd98

customer_reviews.title: It's a excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: The box was broken(opened) when it ship to my home. But the product is very good. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jianliang Liu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It definitely does what it needs to do. Would recommend to anyone in the market for an IEM.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Can you hear me now
customer_reviews.text: These phones are what you pay for. They are not cheap nor cheaply made. Sounds are much better than the $30 specials. One must get accustomed to installing the earpiece in the ear canal.
customer_reviews.author: louieg

customer_reviews.title: Not enough bass
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the se215 for 3 yrs and have enjoyed it. Thought that I would explore what might sound better. The 425 is just as durable and fit my ears perfect but is no where near producing the bass the 215 has, even as I made sure I had a tight seal. Returned it immediately within 8 hrs. and treated me to the 535. Let’s see if the extra money is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: 2bz2shop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, perfect fit, awesome for live performers who need to listen to low frequencies (as bassists or drummers).
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Fróes

customer_reviews.title: Great durable earphones from Shure
customer_reviews.text: Great durable earphones from Shure comes at a price but is well worth the investment. Great for all day listening or a long flight and the in-the-ear design is unbeatable for your workout. Keep in mind that the quality of your source is key for the richest sound replication. If more bass is what you seek after, step up to the e525.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M Saunders II

customer_reviews.title: The material they use feels like a thin cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: For a 300 dollars earphone I was expecting a little more sturdier construction of the casing that holds the earphone mechanism. The material they use feels like a thin cheap plastic. They could have used fiberglass or metal for this price range. I felt I've wasted money on this transaction. The cable was ok and thick which I like. Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: benjamin guitarte

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am just your average music listener, but my take on these earphones is that there is very little (to no) low end sound, which makes for a very lack-luster listening experience. The disproportion of high to low does not provide a full, rich sound. I tried all of the combinations of earpieces to try get the best fit but no earpieces really helped. For the price, I would recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: I own 3 sets of Shure in ears, so ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 sets of Shure in ears, so I thought I'd buy another. I sent the SE425-CL back (they sounded tinny) and bought a of Westone AM PRO 30- I'll never buy another set of Shures.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Shure SE425-CL Sound Isolating Earphones with Dual High Definition MicroDrivers
product_meta.description: Color:ClearShure SE425-CL Sound Isolating Earphones with Dual High Definition MicroDrivers
feature_bullets: Shure CBL-M-+K Music Phone Cable with Remote + Mic for iPone, iPod and iPad available as an additional accessory..Connectivity Technology: Wired
Accurate and Balanced Sound and frequency range is 20 Hertz – 19 Kilo Hertz
Available in clear or metallic silver;lmpedance :22 Ω
Formable wire ensures secure placement over the ear
Convert Shure SE425 Earphones to wireless with the new Bluetooth-Enabled Cable (RMCE-BT1). Sold separately.
Shure CBL-M-+K Music Phone Cable with Remote + Mic for iPone, iPod and iPad works with Shure's SE425 earphones.
Available in clear or metallic silver
Formable wire ensures secure placement over the ear

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars198 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
